Context:
The Office of Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights Services (OAREHRS) is located at George Brown College and promotes fairness, equity, accountability, and transparency. Their services are confidential and include managing human rights complaints, advising on diversity and inclusion, and raising awareness. They have offices at 200 King St. E., Room 246 (St. James Campus), 160 Kendal Ave., Building C, Room C221 (Casa Loma Campus), and 51 Dockside Dr., Room 230 (Waterfront Campus).

Contact information:
- St. James Campus Human Rights Advisor: diversity@georgebrown.ca or 416-415-5000 ext. 4609
- St. James Campus Sexual Violence Response Advisor: 416-415-5000 ext. 3450
- Casa Loma Campus: 416-415-5000 ext. 3668
- Waterfront Campus Human Rights Advisor: 415-5000 ext. 5385

The services are available to all students, staff, and administration at the college. The contact details provided above are for inquiries related to their services, and they also offer a land acknowledgment and provide updates on application deadlines, college news, upcoming events, tours, and more via email sign-up.

Contact numbers:
- College general enquiries: 416-415-2000
- TTY service: 1-877-515-5559
- Customer Service: ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit their social media hub.

The information on this website is subject to change without notice.
